subject: Repent!  The End is Near!
event:
The Arizona Cardinals are playing in the NFC championship.

Surely the last days are at hand.

comments.article:
Warner was done when he left the Rams. Bulger was more than capable at the time.

Warner has been average since then, while being amazing this year.

Bulger has been average/good since then, while being horrible this year.

Warner can really sling it though and the Cards have a puncher's chance in just about any game. I think bad things will happen to them if they play the Giants.

comments.upictitle: Something Clever Here: Legion of the Damned
comments.article: The Ravens beat the Titans! It is so not the end!

They're going to beat the Giants too! HA!


STEELERS/CARDINALS SUPER BOWL ALL THE WAY!


p.s.
Finish the damn book, George.


Thank you.

I think we'll believe the end is nigh when Dance is finished.

I kid in good fun, I know it will be amazing when it arrives, so it's worth the wait.

Yeah, never thought I'd see the day!

And on another note, there's a band called The Sword that has a song called "To Take the Black". And, yes, it's about the Night's Watch. Freakin' sweet.

I am going to find that song. Oh yes, I will find it.

*Runs off to search*

Holy shit, how the hell did that happen?!

. . . erm, I mean, gee, that's great. I think.

(A pale rider on a pale horse just galloped past my window.)

Is this the dying of the light?

Seriously, if the Cards make it to the Superbowl I will truly be convinced of the impending apocalypse.
Couldn't tell by me - I see listings for the Carolina vs Tennessee and thinks it's for a college game :-> I've always been fond of Kurt Warner so I was supporting them for this one.

Kurt Warner = Walder Frey
Jake Delhomme = Sam Tarly
They won't get much farther. They can't. I'm hoping for a Ravens/Giants SuperBowl. And being a native NYer, Giants have to win again.
It's too bad, then, Eli Manning just dethroned Favre for the "Choke Artist of the Year" title.
Its possible you could be onto something there.  What the hell are Arizonans like going to do if we can't roll our eyes at the suckitude of the Cardinals?

I don't know, but at least they've never gone oh-fer-sixteen ...

It's pretty surreal in any case.
comments.subject: 19-year Arizona resident pipes in ...

comments.article:
I was amused to read this on ESPN's front page:

"The Cardinals let everyone in on their secret. That is? They're a full deck of aces, not jokers"

Surely the NFL has regulations against Wild Card virus-enhanced players...
Boooooo. ::Snicker:: That was awesome.

comments.upictitle: Ass McTavish and the land behind the Tavern: pic#5007096
comments.article:
huge cardinals fan here.
i have my sackcloth and ashes around here somewhere...

(so this is what it feels like to win!!?! phenomenal!)
hopefully they will play the chargers then i can save money on a super bowl party.
Damn right. And we best be playin' the Giants next week, past record be damned. 'Cause that'll be the more fun matchup!
If the Chargers beat the Steelers today, I'm going straight to confession.

After watching both games yesterday, I'd say both the Titans and Panthers shot themselves in the foot.

The Titans were rolling the ball up and down the field on the mighty defense of the Ravens. But when you turn the ball over 3 times deep in Ravens territory, you just deserve to lose. Throw in the fact the Titans had about a football field's length of penalties...well it all added up to them deserving to lose that game.

As for Carolina...my last count was 6 turnovers...yep, 6! Give Warner a short field too on some of those, and it's instant points. Plus Carolina's defense seemed non-existant as well.

I hope today's games are just as interesting.
comments.subject: Turnovers

comments.article:
They deserve to be there. They made Carolina look bad.

I'm more ticked about the Ravens than anything. They are one of the dirtiest teams in the league, and yet the refs flag the Titans after the Ravens pretty much tear their running back in half after the play.

I saw only 2 plays that caught my attention yesterday in that game that stood out.

1. I think Flacco stepped out of the endzone, which should have resulted in a safety. I was blown away that wasn't reviewed.
2. I saw Flacco snap a bowl a second after the playclock expired (even the announcers caught this one), and they play stood...which, by the way, resulted in the Ravens getting a great pass play allowed and put them close to field goal position to win the game.

Other than that, the Titans flat out lost that game...turnovers and penalties (89yards worth of them).
comments.subject: eh

comments.article:
Now if only I could get the damn Skins to do something next year, like, oh, I dunno, DUMP JASON CAMPBELL.

-deep breath, deep breath-

It seems to be a weekend for teams named after birds...Ravens and Cardinals upset their hosts.

That's not a good sign with the Eagles coming to town.

Gah, would it be bad if we beat the Eagles and then *lose* to the Cardinals? That would be a stake in the heart equal to Joe Pis...I can't say his name for fear of jinxing us ;)
The sign of the end days would be if we have a Chargers/Cardinals Super Bowl.  Thats when Ill start building the bunker in the back yard :)
all 83 Cardinals fans can't be wrong

The Detroit Lions.  If greatness includes suffering from adversity, then the Lions (my team) are going to be the greatest in history, assuming we cope and overcome.  Which we will, because the Lions are awesome.
comments.subject: Greatest Team Ever

comments.article: im rooting for a chargers/cardinals superbowl since my two teams arent in it. That would probaly be the most entertaining for me.
comments.subject: prediction

comments.article: Yea, I'm shocked as well, but happily so.  I've never been a big Panthers fan (maybe it's the colors???), and with my team out of it I just have to pull for an underdog.  Besides that, the Cardinals are hard to not like.  Warner is a resilient and aging quarterback who's on fire and staging one of the best individual player comebacks we've seen; Larry Fitzgerald is possibly the best receiver in the game right now (at least when there are extremely difficult and quite huge receptions to be made); and everybody picks on the Cardinals.  I know they've earned that rep to a great extent with past failure and then tanking it down the stretch this year, but it's still nice to see them come back the way they have.  Cardinals vs. Chargers would signal the true arrival of ultimate parity in this league, as would all four top seeds losing in the Divisional Playoff, but I don't see that happening.  Things are about to get a whole lot tougher for both.  It's c-c-cold in Pittsburgh, Chargers, and one of the Beasts awaits you, 'Zona.

You're tellin' me.

This is certainly making things interesting.

I am Surprised that the Cards are in the NFC Championship game also! I dont think its the end of the world though. Actually i think its pretty cool the a no name team like the Cards are going. Now im a Big Steelers fan as i am from NW PA. Lets see how they do today against the Chargers!!!!
comments.subject: Steelers Rock!
